p: In another study, Nattudurai et al. [ 21] obtained 100% repellence against S. oryzae after 3 h, using a Y-tube glass olfactometer with essential oil isolated from leaves of Toddalia asiatica at a concentration of 20 ÂµL. In their next experiment, Nattudurai et al. [ 46] observed that the same concentration of diethyl ether fruit extract also exhibited a 100% repellent activity against S. oryzae. An identical intensity of repellence (100%) against rice weevil was recorded by Ogendo et al. [ 47] after a 24 h exposure to oil and eugenol from Ocimum gratissimum at concentrations of 0.15% and 0.2% ( v/w).
